column2:
The place is only two minutes off the main street to Acropolis and Museum i would recommend you do find it is next to a small supermarket.
When we walked in was meet by the owner / chef , his passion came over about the way he cooked and freshness of the food. The menu is not vast witch makes it easy for your choice, it as a good wine list in stock. From your order you can watch it being cooked as there just a small glass divider, witch makes it nice see it all as the ower say it fresh. We had a couple main course and pudding, drinks and i found it good value.

Called a couple off times for cuppa and sweet, the cakes can not fault the ice cream
Is just like home made. The prices are just above average but as a treat and away on holiday why not.

Called here for afternoon cuppa and sweet, found it be so relaxing decided to call for a evening meal.
Went back to try for a evening meal sat in side, having nice Greek musci in the background was nice as we could talk with ease. Had a beaf hot pot with a pasta ozio.
The pork tomahawk is amazing size and taste, three drinks and olives and bread it came to just over 45 euros it was a good value for money evening.

Had afternoon coffe and sweet, and decided to try that evening for a meal.
The evening was a nice atmosphere, staff pleasant and help with the orders.
The T bone was nice to try nice dun as requested. The Chicken in the over a nice dish with potato, for a restaurant right in the main area off the Acropolis and Museum it was good value

I would say try be there early for two pionts one is you like take picture's you have a better chance two it harder to walk round with the volume of poeple.
Good foot wear as the marble you walk on can be veary slippery, and it a good climb.
After walking round i over heard a tour guide and if you thinking about going on one i would recommend as it fascinating to know.
The Acropolis is amazing structure's and the feeling you get on how thay lived and worship the Gods.

First i must push try be there early before 11.am.The queue soon build up and can be waiting hr plus
The stone and articles are amazing to see as it give you the feeli g off the spender of the times around BC to AD.
When you been in side the museum you can go under the building it self and see the ruins off the time around the way poeple lived and there homes.

The Temple is only a few column it not much to see as there you are restricted to get closer to the columns as thay doing work.
Quite a bit off the site is over grown.the gate fee is only 4 euros witch is more than enough to pay.

For the 6 euro you can spend easy over one to two hours, looking at the investment of war from the stone age to world war two.
As well the clothing thay wear. As well the guns and swords.
You find it good too read about each section off the different yrs off war.

The hotel from arriving is stunning and as that feeling off opulence.
After booking a Deluxe Double room , went to room and it was over looking the pool room 368, from the the website picture it showed it was views looking out to the city.
I did go to ask at reception and the nice concierge said i could have a room over looking the main road but is nosey with trafic.
The rooms have that nice warm and lush feel and veary large bed, as well veary comfortable to sleep on.
The breckfast is served on top floor 7 and as the stunning views of athens land mark's food is fresh and a good selection from any country you come from, staff are extremely polite and friendly.
Did look at the evening menu but for me i feel for a three courses and couple drinks it would be around 150 euros per head, i feel it was bit high even tho nice views. But haveing beautiful meal out side the hotel five minutes away for just 30 euros a head.
The views can be seen in the day buy walking round the city.
My only one disappointment, unknown to me my wife had booked a serprize in the room on arrival as it was my 60th, but it was not there and never arrive at any time off the stay. If i knew this i would have Inquired but was only told when we had got home.
I would recommend this hotel if you looking for luxury place to stay. As well so easey to all the attraction.

Haveing stayed here a couple time i find the hotel, is allways clean.
But first time i booked a room with city view that being at the back off the hotel
room i feel needed a little more cleaning the smaller details, the linen was clean tho.
Being at back off the hotel it over looks apartments and some one had a dog, witch left out most off the time was barking so it was not quiet at all.
I would recommend now try book a room at the frount off the hotel.
The corridors in the hotel are in need off some TLC. But it clean.

column1: Help take the rush out off going away
column2:
The booking in easy , and as you can leave your car for the time you are away.
The rooms are clean, beds are ok but getting a bed that comfort needs atention, i my self could not full night sleep before getting up for flight.
But knowing i can shower and be fresh for my flight is a good feeling.
There is a service to take you to ur gate and when on return from your vacation again the service is there to pic you up.

From arriving at Manchester airport, it so easy to book in and as easyjet have there own, section and veary helpful staff it was a pleasure.
On board the plane the staff make every one settled as fast as possible to get flight up and going.
On board service was a pleasure, one passenger was in fear off flying and watch staff make that person so relaxed was nice to see.
I would recommend easy jet any time.

Booking on line easey, and plenty follow up on, information with flights and any extra when getting duty free items.
Pleasant staff from checking in and on the plane the service polite and a nice friendly smile.

This is a lovely relaxing atmosphere in the main street close to the old church, staff so welcoming and polite.
The menu is good and you find that you not disappointed on any off the items on offer, and plenty full.
I did the takeaway couple time, and have to say one off best pizza to go.
One thing you have to consider as it all cooked to order, so it can take little time, but have say you not be disappointed at all.
I would recommend that you book a table to make shure of a place, it soon fills up.

From being told about the restaurant, and it being of the main drag off restaurant, i would say it was nice to find a place were you site ,just a few table's, and soft back ground music you can talk with out shouting as well not ear the over table's.
There a good menu, to choose from, and it all fresh made , witch if you wish can see the oppen kitchen.
You can sit at the bar if you wish have a cocktail, or after the meal.
The staff so helpful in explaining the menu of any off the dishes.
Was so enjoyable went twice.

First yes it the steps if i recall about 87ish from the new harbour, but best is all down hill when having a lovely meal.
From the menu there not a vast list but it dont stop from the quality, as from calling couple time while being on the Island it was filling and taist meal.
I would say the staff so polite and do anything to make your evening enjoyable.
I asked Pam the ower, for owner second visit could she get fresh strawberry, as there was not on the sweet list, Pam had them for me when we called agsin.
To me that was nice touch to sort it, seeing i was not a local.

First time at The Flying Pig, The place as a welcoming atmosphere, we booked a table for a meal.
First thing which i add not realised it allowed dogs and in the eating area as well, the time we were there, i noticed that on three tables in the eating area were six dogs.
The food was normal pub grub, it was tasty, but the amounts you get were not justified by the prices. I myself had ribeye which was only 6 inch in diameter, one tomato cut in half three onion rings and a small basket of frys, small jar of jus , witch was priced £23.95.
I would expect with the amount being served, around the £15 mark .
When we asked for the bill, we showed them our local discount card, so then having the discount deducted, we had a £50. Gift voucher.
When coming to pay, they first did not take the discount voucher off so had to redo the bill again. This time they did not give us the local discount so it finshed up paying full price.
They put pressure on trying to resolve this and we finshed up having to leave.
My over view would be if your looking for a bar meal, and happy paying over the odds and ok with dogs sat round you as eat then The flying Pig ok.

We had ower Christmas dinner ,for the first time at the Waterside, there was plenty of parking on the day. When arriving at the Waterside was greeted warmly by the bar staff.
Table was ready and we sat down to the Christmas meal.
The food was plenty full and with all trimmings as well. We had a chat to the head chef, he said easy day as there was only 62 covers today.
The place was not busy so was nice to be able to chat.
It was a shame there was no Christmas music played at all why we were there.i would say as a over all i felt it was just like a normal pub meal and Christmas atmosphere was not there.the meal total came to £120 for three.

Went for a pub meal, as you walk in throw the revolving door you enter the old style of the George Hotel, as a warm and friendly atmosphere.
Walking on throw to the lounge bar, you go in to a modern environment smart and relaxing with a oppen wood fire.
Sat down after ordering at the bar and had a good afternoon lunch.
Service was polite and friendly smiles as well.i would like to recommend the Fish platter, fresh and plenty full.

This is a relaxing place to enjoy the finer things in life even nice to see a nice real coal fire to relax by , beautiful views and surroundings.
The afternoon tea it plentyfull and tasty, and having very friendly staff. No problem parking.

First time at Two Sister , and found the place easey to find and free parking.
Had the cream tea, and i was not disappointed there was so much to eat, i asked for a box to take rest home.

column1: If not just the View its the Food as well
column2:
From sitting down on the balcony you see all the town and the nearby islands..
Food you can't go wrong with it's cooked in a clay oven outside so you can see the food being cooked, staff are so friendly, and it is a family run restaurant.
The prices are as you would pay in town Average, 4 drinks ,2 starters 2 main and 2 sweets, around, 65 euro.
Taxi expect to pay around 14 to 16 euro from town each way.

The Taverna is in a nice old part of the town, it is a nice quite place, out look over a small bay, plenty of room to relax, family run.
From placing an order ask the waiter to describe your order. so you know what you're getting the right item you are excepting.
From our order that was Rib's and we was given Lamb Chops, and Veal in tomato, and was given, Beef Cheeks ? The lamb chops tough.
This does not mean all experiences are the same.

Good quality home made italian food.
Service was alittle on slow side but was busy but the atmosphere was good.
Food very enjoyable and not expensive.
Walk up past the cocktail bar up to the old church and it is on the right hand side of the church.

Good tasty dona meat, you not be disappointed.
Walk up main street when you see a local food shop on left take the left fork and you see No Name on the left at the corner.

The place is easy to find it's one street back of main street on old harbour,
You can see the food being cooked, there is a good range of meats
and chicken on offer, one will find its a nice change from a fish meal.
Friendly staff and not to expensive.

First when booking ask if there is any show etc on at the out door amphitheatre
as it can be quite noisy in the late evening if you trying to sleep, if you booked a sea view room.
Very clean hotel, realy polite staff, breckfast buffett is a good selection.
It may look a little tired in places but it was clean.
We had to wait 15 minutes for transport, and they charged us €20 yet later on a local taxi it was only €14, for return journey. So beware of being over charged.

column1: As this changed for the better ?
column2:
First thing you see is a total change in looks and set out, it is now under new ownership.
For my first impressions i feel they are going for fine dinning, but feel looks are not the same as i would expect if one is aiming for fine dinning.
From sitting down was given menu and left for five minutes, and was no offer of a drink,
considering there was only one other couple in the restaurant, and seven members of staff.
The portions were a good size, food was tasty, but felt my prawns and mussels were a little over cooked. As mussels had shunk to the size of a pea.

Nice locationat the end of the old harbour, you sit facing the boats and old town.
It can be very noisy and it caters for the younger clientele.
The atmosphere is good .
The thing you well find the drinks are very over priced i got two small beer and it was
€10. So be careful as the evening can become expensive .

Polite staff fast service, good vast menu, and you can ask as well for a dish not on menu.
Nice view of old harbour.
Value three beers one wine one start between two, and two main course, you looking about €57.
You feel you had a nice meal and full.

The flight was good, was a early flight would recomend try book in earlier then two hrs, as thay veary bissy with lot of flights at this time in the morning.
With the two hr time differance in Skiathos you find a 6 am flight from Manchester you land in Skiathos late morning (11.45) ish.
We booked extra leg room, it helps to stretch out.0

The flight was so straight forward booking done on line, then do your own check in whitch is so easy but there is staff to help if needed and so polite with a smile, whitch makes it a nice start to your trip.

The place is very cosy candle lit atmosphere the tables are far enough apart to have a nice romantic evening. The listing of the Menu on offer is traditional and good variety.
Of the two visits trying different meals there was no faults at all.

You can spend all day if you take in all the attractions and best booking a Full ticket as when I did they said I could use over two days to see all.
To see some off the attractions you have to pay at booking office in the square.

The Bridge can be very busy, best times early morning , or late evening there a few trade stalls and buskers.
It can be accessed with wheel chair even though it is a cobbled Bridge.

It was nice to find after walking round Prague its interesting as the face revolves ,
as it made in layers whitch in turn rotate changing the look of the face.

Being the second time at the Hotel and after emailing a few weeks before arriving I request a room higher than second floor, when arriving was allocate a room on the four floor and a up grade from a Deluxe Double to an Executive Double this was amazing, with Champagne Chocolate's.
Being higher than second floor the noise from the trams is a lot quieter.
I would recommend this hotel as five star with five star service.
It nice to walk round Prague and take in some amazing building and Architecture, as you will see from some of Pictures taken.
Nice relaxing atmosphere, good enjoyable food and reasonable prices, The duck and red cabage with dumplings tasty meal. As well the goulash in bread basket .

Warming inviting entrance to the bar area then stairs takening you down to coffee area and then more stairs takening you in to the main restaurant.
Its light informal and relaxing, with the first time there i was met by Lloyd the owner, he was polite and helpful sorting table and looking after our service, threw all the meal he was overseeing our service.
The food was generous portions for pub food , hot tasty and no disappointment.

Went for six year old birthday party only three adults three children, yet the service took to long to order it was terrible. Sat waiting from taken the table we booked took half hr before a order, taken but that was drinks and food. Then had to wait forty five minutes for it to arrive, noting veg was so over cooked the tasted of just water. With the drinks a pint of Guinness was ordered and we noticed it was pulled and sat on bar till food was delivered witch was forty-five minutes.
If you know about Guinness it nice to see the Setling of the pint not flat with no life.
From having the main meal, sweet and one coffee was ordered and with my surprise and half hour wait, then they for got coffee and when that landed we all finshed, the sweet.
I find the service very slow even tho it was quite in the place many empty tables.
The food was cold and the price of the Guinness £6.50 a pint that i regard very expensive.

It is a easy place to find just walk round the area of the Church Trion Lerarchon Square, old town.
The setting in the street gives it a romantic ambiance. you find the food plenty full and a good selection as well and it is good value you be looking for couple off drinks two starters and main followed by two sweet average price around 60 to 70 euros.

The setting is nice under the Tree were it is situated, the food is nice and plenty full
the garlic stuffed bread is a must. Good selection of pizza.
You can get same meal at the Marias Pizza opposite the Town Hall for half the price.
.

The place is next to the Town Hall only set up in the evening, even thou it is in the street it can be fun as one minuet a bike well go by and general public. The food is good and good value, for a quick sit down evening meal.

The setting in the old Harbour is a nice setting for nice meal, with the new menu, and great staff.
I would say if you doing a starter and haven drinks with your meal try a tipalo, it a shot of Ouzo with a tapas it fun as each tipalo you get a different tapas.
Makes the evening exciting before you go for the mail meal.

The place as a warming feel and amazing atmosphere , even though we were seated on the upper level at the back of the restaurant.
Nice soft music in the back ground.
The food is good quality and nice portions and good value for money.
To get seated on the lower level I would book a table, and you not be disappointed.

Called in one afternoon had a drink, then went back for a evening meal, not a large place but as a warm feel to it.
The food it full some and tasty, and plenty as well. Good value and you leave your own tip, and if you tip well you be given local shot, got some kick lol.
It well be a place I go back to as it more of a local restaurant in the city of Prague.
Booking on line the papper work you need simple to follow and it provides a good honest service, from point A to B.

From the warm welcome from the staff booking in is easy, we stayed in Deluxe Double room, on the second floor facing the front of Hotel.
There plenty of room very large bed. There is tea and coffee provide with a well stock fridge and snacks. The TV as got full European service.
The room was cleaned daily and new linen. The breakfast, is freshly made and a good overall selection, from hot to cold, you may find the plates small but you can always go get more so not to over indulge.
Couple off points to remember if booking a room if you are looking to book the front of the Hotel, the tram system goes pass the front of Hotel and it is nosey and you can feel the vibration when they pass, it runs from 5 am to 12 pm daily. So I would suggest trying for third floor up. the over point even though the baths room are stunning, it can be difficult as the bath side is quit high.

Wonderful service, and beautiful surrounding.
Good selection on the menu, and can not fault the quality.
From the Old town you can walk with in five minutes to top branded shops to Charles Bridge, Astronomical Clock etc..

Nice walk over the Bridge with the different stone statues and the blessing cross were you can bless your soul.
It can get very busy mid day.
The food is ok but the amount you get for the amount you pay is not justified. But it as got a nice setting to eat and relax
It looks better then the movement, if you hoping to see the clock try make Shure you face the clock to see the full clock in action on the hr, try be there no later than five to the hr.
column4: Old Town Hall with Astronomical Clock

column2: It is a nice surprize as there different ways in to the Gardens but when you arrive, you find it relaxing and tranquil.

The place as a relaxing feel,good friendly service fine dining good home cooked modern food.
Save room for pudding and there is a good selection of wines.
It's a must to book as it's the only way you be able get a table try booking around 9.30 /10.00
As greeks eat late and there a good atmosphere and ambiance.

column1: Value For Money Good Central Location
column2:
The Hotel as a nice welcoming reception area, nice bar with relaxing area and place to eat light meals.
The room Classic Double With Sea View, is a big enough room and as a out side eating area looking out to the sea.
Room was cleaned every day with fresh towels daily.
I would stay again as it very and handy to walk in to town or train station.
There are good coffee bars and restaurants.
Points to note,
There is a DVD player in the room but you must bring your own DVDs as there none DVD library.
Hotel reception cold be bit more help full on arrival with the hotel amenities.
There is no information book in the rooms about things to do and amenities of the Hotel.
The Hotel it self could do with a fleshing up as the carpets in places have seen some wear and tear, Even though it clean.
The staff are very friendly and polite especial in restaurant and bar.

The place is warming and friendly and plenty of room to enjoy your meal, nice open fire in winter.
The is fresh home cooked food by the chef who as been working there for 18 yr.
One thing I would say in Volos they do tsipouro { tipalo } were you pay for a shot and get a free tapa style starter you find this in most restaurant, so if you going to have a starter with meal ask about tsipouro first more fun. With ice and a tot of water.

The simple way to book on emails they good Value and from there emails they do as they say keep you up to date.
I would say we had transfer from Athens Airport to Volos and return was best value for money after I did some shopping round.

column1: Must see it makes you feel soulsome
column2:
You well feel the power off the Greek influence off the stunning architecture,and religion.
The place is so nice to see and being in the town centre you can relaxes over coffee as well restaurant's

The gardens show were the two hundred years of experience in the planting.
The place to more interesting building about the past and the reflection of the war they went throw.

From time you walk in the staff are so polite and friendly, even the basic double room i booked was clean and relaxing,
The bar as ample space to relaxe and room to wacth the large TV.
The breakfast room is spacious, and the food hot and plenty and able to go refill as much as you require.

The Hotel is right in the city and to get around on foot makes it easer then taxi.
The room's are self contained to do self-catering, even tho you can B/B the breakfast self service and plenty of it as well, the staff helpful to help in eny way.
If you doing a transfer when flinging in to Melbourne you can book at airport and if works out cheaper as well. If wish eat out, you be spoiled with ever kind of food on offerin the City, I would suggest try the side street as it less tourist and amazing quality.
The tram service is good and free long you stay in the city zones.

The gardens are nice to walk round and places to stop rest take in all the tree's and amazing plant's .
In the gardens make your way to the War Menorial, this i would say a must. Allow about a good two hours it amazing the way the event's of why and how it was built, and go in side to the main part up the steps and listen to the member of staff explain 11/11/11. It's veary meaning full and a strong sense of honour to what thay went through.

First if you fit walk all the way from the town your looking around a good hr, all up hill but when there you forget the walk, and down hill on way back. There some nice views as well walking.
The Monastery is veary soul full no matter your faith, in side it has stunning painting and decoration, the museum is only €2 and tells you all about the Monastery.
The shop as ther own olive oil and honey and over items, have to say the honey is nice.
There is a cafe but i did no try but it handy.
There is a bus service from the town if you like get there quicker.

The place is way to get to from bus stop 18, walking well take good two hr plus there no bus this way so transport would help, at the same time you can call at the dog sanctuary.
The Monastery is only two minet past dog sanctuary.
When you get there you may see the door closed, but just oppen and walk in to the small square, if thif Monastery church closed thay oppen it for you, thay do ask for small donation for the up keep.
It may look dark on the walls but with the bamp over years but you see if you look veary old paintings, look at the cieling you see God .

Well first thing is the place is right in the old town and looking over the harbour, the apartment as every thing one needs, noting it self catering.
Fresh bread just five minutes away for morning breakfast, as for the evening you are spoiled with Skiathos town on your door step, for any kind of food.
If you do go for Koulas House, i would say all you need bring is your own coffee and tea.
When you land your greeted by Nina the ower kind and polite with fresh fruit and wine.
Just feels like home but with the sunshine.

The Monastery may be small but it as a warm soul feeling and well worth going.
When you land you may see the main door closed it well oppen when you go in side if the Monastery door closed thay well oppen for you.
When you go in side look up and see the painting of holey Christ .

When landing at airport you get on underground train, that then takes you to the harbour, when you cum out on to main street walk just a few metre, you find your self look at the harbour bridge that takes your breath away, seeing we travelled from England.
There is a nice cafe just on the harbour side with the back drop of the Bridge and Opera House

column1: You want Meat this the place to go
column2: The place is round the corner from the town hall, it is on a small street and it all out side eating, all the tables are down one side of the street. You can see the meat of your choice cooking over a barbecue it is a large barbecue. The meat is amazing tender melt in the mouth veary bissey place go early .

Nice setting behind the church, good service and polite, food veary tasty
Would go back again. Not a large restaurant but gets veary bissey so would recomend early.

The place is stell nice to sit and view, but staff seam to be veary chatty with each over but no time for customers. As it changed hands ?
Visited last year and all good, this year, tiny portion sizes and different menu but price are expensive are you paying for the view.

The setting in the harbour is nice , nice family run business.
Food good quality you can pick your own daily caught freshly fish,
to have with your meal.
Had many meals and every one good.

This is the wonderful hotel to book your wedding and to stay and Susan the Manager is so Helpful in eny way she can, the rest off the staff do eny thing for you to make your stay wonderful. It is at bus stop 10 and if you going get a Bus to town it fun as you find out when you ride it, Only take ten mins to town.

column1: got to go ask see the brass plack at the till
column2:
I can say eny off the rood on the menu is fab.
Went throw all the menu when we stayed
It is run by a local family and you feel this as it shows way thay look after you as like one off the Family

Simple menu and top quality food,
Try ask for the top floor and a seat near the sea
and friday is fun watching the planes fly lower than you.
This is a wonderful place to eat , book the Balcony but book well in-advance as it only do two sitting, but wearth the view and so romantic

As for the food upon arrival waiting a good 15 mins before any service, from drinks order never got the water we requested. The food arrived cold, more than one of the main courses, as I remarked about I was told it would be replaced and recooked, it came back with just warm plates and same food, noting my pasta dish was dryer showing it was not a fresh dish.
Note I did not eat the meal and was taken away, then when it came to paying for the evening they charged for the meal I sent back.
As for the service we was not looked after.
I never had a pasta made with only tin tomatoes and tin tuna.
VERY DISSAPOINTED WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND
